channel.title: {CMD} problem
channel.description:
ok I got a problem idk from what is it when i went to my cmd and typed in anything its not working everything is unrecognized so i dont get anything is this because something is deleted or what because i got many problems on this new computer im trying to fix so this is what i get on all [code] C:\Documents and Settings\user>ipconfig 'ipconfig' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
C:\Documents and Settings\user>ipconfig/all 'ipconfig' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
C:\Documents and Settings\user>ping website.com 'ping' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
C:\Documents and Settings\user>NOTHING RECOGNIZED !! how to fix :([/code]
So could you help me please, Thanks !!

item.title: {CMD} problem
item.dc:creator: @xJavac xJavac
item.description:
@xJavac wrote:

Ik you already solved this, but a even faster way (omg right. lol :p) is too just click “Run as Administrator” (even if your account is admin on your computer, it doesn’t always run the program with admin rights.), and type in the command. “ipconfig” in this case.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @skullz_scoop skullz scoop
item.description:
@skullz_scoop wrote:

Thanks for you 2 this helped me so much thanks if i was able to rep++ would done it.

item.title: {CMD} problem
item.dc:creator: @dun_dun_dun dun dun dun
item.description:
@dun_dun_dun wrote:

Wrong place to post this but i’ll help anyway.

Type this in the CMD Prompt.

cd C:\Windows\System32\

Then just do either ipconfig or ipconfig /all

Quick way of doing it.

Read full topic

item.title: {CMD} problem
item.dc:creator: @mc_wobbla mc wobbla
item.description:
@mc_wobbla wrote:

i decided to google your problem lol, and got this

When you type any command in the command prompt in Windows, it says that it can’t recognize the command you’ve typed. There are two possibilities: First that you have typed the command incorrectly. Check your spellings. Second that you have actually typed the command correctly but it is not in the directories where command prompt looks for commands. Those directories are defined here:
Right click My Computer –> Properties –> Advanced –> Environment variables –> In system variables, double click on Path to edit the settings. Make sure you have these two directories defined in your path variable: C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS

for windows 7, the path is “C:\WINDOWS\system32; C:\Windows;”

i hope it helped

Read full topic

@skullz_scoop wrote:

ok I got a problem idk from what is it when i went to my cmd and typed in anything its not working everything is unrecognized so i dont get anything is this because something is deleted or what because i got many problems on this new computer im trying to fix so this is what i get on all

[code]

‘ping’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
